SEARCH

Class Main

java.lang.Object
Main
public class Main extends Object
Main class parses a given input file and generates the parse tree of the input file in LaTeX. Ensures also that the command is correctly written and handles errors.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • scan

      private static List<List<Symbol>> scan(String inputFile) throws IOException
      Scans the input file using the LexicalAnalyzer and generates two lists of Symbols: 1. input1: With terminals changed (ex: 0 -> [Number] and x -> [VarName]) 2. input2: Without terminals changed (ex: 0 -> 0 and x -> x)

      input1 will be used by the parser for the parsing process. input2 will be used by the parser to generate the parse tree.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - The path to the input file.
      Returns:
      A list containing two lists of Symbols.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • parse

      private static Parser parse(String inputFile) throws IOException
      Parses the input file using the LL(1) recursive descent parser and output on stdout the leftmost derivation of the input if it is correct or an explanatory error message if there is a syntax error.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - The path to the input file to be parsed.
      Returns:
      A Parser object representing the parsing result if the input word is part of the grammar.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the grammar is not LL(1) or the input word is not part of the grammar.
      IOException - If there is an error reading the input file.

    • parseAndBuildParseTree

      private static void parseAndBuildParseTree(String inputFile, String filename) throws IOException
      Parses the input file, builds the parse tree of the input and writes it to a LaTeX file called filename.tex
      Parameters:
      inputFile - The path to the input file to be parsed.
      filename - The name of the output LaTeX file to store the parse tree.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error reading the input file or writing the parse tree file.
